Headline: Le Creuset and All-Clad Cookware Is Majorly Marked Down at Sur La Table Right Now
Body:
Listen up, kitchen gurus: Sur La Table is serving up some unmissable deals ahead of Black Friday. Each year without fail, the Friday after Thanksgiving brings slashed prices on almost everything we could possibly wish for ‚Äî and this year is no exception.

Although there are still a few weeks left until Black Friday, which lands on November 29, Sur La Table is already marking down prices on covetable cookware brands like Le Creuset and All-Clad. Right now, you can snag kitchen essentials from these brands and more for up to 55 percent off.

If you simply can‚Äôt wait until Black Friday to start saving on popular kitchen appliances, we rounded up a few of the best Sur La Table deals you can shop right now.

Headline: Skamania deputies say remains of missing mushroom picker found
Body:
The Skamania County Sheriff‚Äôs Office said Thursday that an Oregon man who went missing in Gifford Pinchot National Forest nearly two weeks ago has been found dead.

The sheriff‚Äôs office provided no other details about locating the remains of Richard L. Sugai, 78, of Beaverton, Ore.

Sugai was reported overdue from a mushroom-picking day trip late afternoon Oct. 19. Sugai‚Äôs last known location was Forest Service Road 60, about 10 miles north of Carson, according to the sheriff‚Äôs office.

Sugai was in the area with family, who has reportedly picked mushrooms there for decades, according to the sheriff‚Äôs office. The family told deputies that Sugai has a condition that requires daily medication. He was dressed for the torrential rain, but his clothing was darkly colored.

Deputies suspended their search for Sugai on Tuesday.
Label: Not Incident

Headline: Location, location: One-of-a-kind Alpine Mountain Ranch & Club in Steamboat Springs epitomizes real estate‚Äôs golden rule
Body:
When pressed on answering why his clients purchased their mountain-modern dream home in Steamboat Springs, Chris Paoli can‚Äôt nail down one specific reason.

The unrivaled views of the South Valley, the Flat Tops, Emerald Mountain and proximity to Steamboat Ski Resort? Certainly.

The home itself ‚Äî a beautiful, mountain-contemporary design, blending bold elements that are both rustic and sleek? Yes, definitely a factor.

Unparalleled amenities, including steps-away access to the Steamboat Ski Resort gondola from the ranch‚Äôs private social club, access to fly-fishing on a stretch of the Yampa River, or miles of groomed cross country skiing and snowshoe trails out the door of your home? Yes, yes and yes.

					
				

‚ÄúThe list of reasons (for purchasing at Alpine Mountain Ranch  Club) is endless,‚Äù says Paoli, owner/broker at Colorado Group Realty. ‚ÄúMy clients are often active families, so the lifestyle-driven amenities AMRC offers check a lot of boxes.‚Äù

His most recent sale was a newly completed home at the ranch, listed at $4,495,000. The home spreads 5,700 square feet of living space across two levels. The eye-catching, mountain-contemporary design incorporates expansive glass, metal cladding and steel columns in lieu of timber to produce clean lines and a sophisticated look.

Making this home truly unique, however, is its location inside Alpine Mountain Ranch  Club, an exclusive, 1,216-acre land preservation community featuring 63 5-acre homesites and 900 acres dedicated to wildlife preserve.

‚ÄúThe Ranch is an irreplaceable asset,‚Äù says Paoli. ‚ÄúIt is a one-of-a-kind piece of land. If ‚Äòlocation, location, location‚Äô is the golden rule of real estate, AMRC is it. It backs to the ski area. It backs to the national forest. It‚Äôs only minutes from Steamboat and the ski resort. It‚Äôs a true gem of a property.‚Äù

Layering on the uniqueness of the property are the amenities provided at AMRC, which include equestrian facilities, an owners‚Äô lodge, a guest cabin and a private backcountry retreat. There‚Äôs also an on-site lake for fishing, paddleboarding or relaxing on the dock.

					
				


While this home has been scooped up, more opportunities await interested parties at AMRC.

‚ÄúThere is another spec home for sale right now, which we call Sunset Retreat,‚Äù says AMRC director of sales Suzanne Schlicht. ‚ÄúIt is of a similar size but sits in a different area of the Ranch. It also has a spectacular view corridor.‚Äù

Schlicht says they are going to continue building homes at AMRC, as the recent sale ‚Äî and a handful of others in the Steamboat area ‚Äî serves as proof that there is a market for homes at the Ranch. In fact, they are breaking ground on a new home in the near future.

‚ÄúCustomers are seeing the value in these homes,‚Äù Schlicht says. ‚ÄúPlus, the Ranch is such a special place. You‚Äôre right on the edge of Steamboat Springs, but when you‚Äôre here, you might as well be a hundred miles away.‚Äù

For more information, call Schlicht at 970-846-0817 or visit AlpineMountainRanch.com.

The news and editorial staffs of The Denver Post had no role in this post‚Äôs preparation.
Label: Not Incident

Headline: Poll: Battleground States Oppose Impeaching Trump, Showing Dems Have a Desperate Fight Ahead of Them
Body:
Rep. Adam Schiff, D-Calif., ranking member of the House Intelligence Committee, accompanied by House Minority Leader Nancy Pelosi of Calif. and other congress members speaks during a news conference on Trump Putin Helsinki Summit at Capitol Hill in Washington on Tuesday, July 17, 2018. (AP Photo/Jose Luis Magana)

If the Democrats are hoping impeachment will go their way, more and more evidence has come out showing that it may be a bit more damaging to them than they initially thought.

According to The Hill, swing states aren‚Äôt too keen on removing Trump from office through impeachment despite saying that an investigation is supported:

Support for impeachment is under water in new surveys of Wisconsin and Florida, two key states in next year‚Äôs fight for the White House. Trump won both in 2016, turning Wisconsin red for the first time in decades and returning Florida to the GOP column after former President Obama carried it twice. In New Hampshire and Arizona, two more swing states, most voters oppose impeachment. Democratic nominee Hillary Clinton narrowly won the Granite State in 2016, and Democrats believe they have a chance to win Arizona after securing a Senate race last year. A New York Times‚ÄìSiena College battlegrounds poll released Wednesday found that majorities in Michigan, North Carolina, Pennsylvania, Wisconsin, Arizona and Florida oppose removing the president from office through impeachment. Majorities or pluralities do support an investigation of Trump, however.

In other words, uncovering the story is perfectly fine, but voters would rather not jump on board the impeachment train unless it‚Äôs warranted. If Democrats were counting on a populace that would zealously jump on the impeachment bandwagon from the get-go, they definitely aren‚Äôt getting one.

‚ÄúWe‚Äôve known for a long time that everybody in California and New York want Trump to be impeached, they‚Äôve wanted that since the day he came into office,‚Äù an anonymous Trump campaign official told The Hill. ‚ÄúBut in these states where the election is really going to be fought, we‚Äôre seeing that voters oppose impeachment, and there‚Äôs an intensity to that opposition.‚Äù

Republicans have been suspicious that impeachment polling in the past has been heavily weighted due to participates being from states that tend to be smurf blue in terms of party loyalty. This polling from swing states paints an entirely different picture. Specifically, if we look at Wisconsin, which polling shows impeachment is a losing battle, especially among independents:

The same can be said of New Hampshire:

Despite this, an anonymous GOP pollster said that this is still bad news for Republicans. That impeachment approval is even this high is still ominous.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs not a good thing that bare majorities oppose removing Trump from office in these key states,‚Äù said one GOP pollster who requested anonymity. ‚ÄúRemoving the president from office should be a really big deal, almost unthinkable, and reserved for the biggest scandals or wrongdoing. So only eking out 51 percent or 52 percent opposition in these states isn‚Äôt good.‚Äù

‚ÄúThat said, these numbers definitely show that there‚Äôs lots of room for Democrats to handle this badly and hand Trump a second term,‚Äù the pollster continued.

What this does show, however, is that voters are more skeptical than they are sure. As the investigation proceeds, these numbers will no doubt shift, but the question is, by how much? Battleground states are currently leaning away from Trump in general, and even states where he won by double digits like South Carolina have been reduced to single digits. Should the investigation conclude that Trump did nothing wrong ‚Äî again ‚Äî he may experience an approval boost as Democrats once again take themselves to extremes to try to desperately prove their suspicions right.

Time will tell, but the polling proves that Trump isn‚Äôt the one who needs to fight desperately here and it‚Äôs all the Democrat‚Äôs game to lose.
Label: Not Incident

Headline: Ivanka Trump brutally mocked after tweet comparing her father to Thomas Jefferson
Body:
On Thursday morning ‚Äî as the House of Representatives was preparing to vote on a resolution to proceed with an impeachment inquiry against President Donald Trump ‚Äî his daughter, White House senior adviser Ivanka Trump, took to Twitter and made a Donald Trump/Thomas Jefferson comparison. And it wasn‚Äôt long before she was lambasted for it by fellow Twitter users.

In her Halloween 2019 tweet, Ivanka Trump quoted a letter that Jefferson (the third president of the United States) wrote to his oldest daughter, Martha Jefferson Randolph, in 1801 during an election crisis: ‚Äú‚Ä¶surrounded by enemies and spies catching and perverting every word that falls from my lips or flows from my pen, and inventing where facts fail them.‚Äù Jefferson was describing the state of politics in Washington, D.C., and after quoting him in her tweet, Ivanka Trump wrote, ‚ÄúSome things never change, dad!‚Äù

The implication was that just as Jefferson (who served as president from 1801-1809) was unfairly smeared by politicians in his day, so is her father in 2019. And not surprisingly, many Twitter users disagreed strongly with the comparison.

@ HoarseWisperer angrily responded, ‚ÄúYou are the most vapid tool ever to step foot in the White House,‚Äù and @Amy_Siskind tweeted, ‚ÄúYour family is a crime syndicate running our government.  Hopefully, all of you end up in prison where you belong.‚Äù Another biting quote came from @davehoag, who posted, ‚ÄúDoes anyone know if Thomas Jefferson and Martha Jefferson Randolph also laundered money for Iran‚Äôs Revolutionary Guard?‚Äù

Journalist David Rothkopf explained why a Donald Trump/Thomas Jefferson comparison was wildly inappropriate, posting, ‚ÄúSo, Ivanka, couple things: a.) Jefferson worked his whole life to ensure the president was not above the law b.)  Jefferson was the first top official to call for the impeachment of a president (Washington) for being too close a foreign nation (when he approved the Jay Treaty).‚Äù

Twitter user @maydaymindy9 described the president‚Äôs daughter as ‚Äúan empty vessel in a plastic casing,‚Äù while @RobinMadel posted, ‚ÄúSorry, Ivanka doesn‚Äôt history very well.‚Äù And @Emolclause explained, ‚ÄúWhite House staffers didn‚Äôt throw up their hands in exasperation over Thomas Jefferson‚Äôs LIES.‚Äù

On Thursday, the House voted 232-196 for the impeachment inquiry against President Trump to move forward. The votes came down along mostly partisan lines, with Republicans voting against the resolution and most Democrats voting in favor of it.
Label: Not Incident

Headline: OMD celebrate 40 electric years on a night to remember
Body:
The acoustics are sensational but such opulent surroundings can lead to quiet, respectful crowds that sit and watch rather than interact.

But that certainly wasn't the case when OMD brought their 40 Anniversary Tour to Tyneside.

From start to finish, the crowd were clearly intent on winning the prize for the most enthusiastic ever seen at the Sage.

The applause and cheers that followed every song was louder and lengthier than most bands get for an encore. Not bad for an audience that was primarily made up of fans in the their late-40s, 50s and early-60s!

For the best part of two hours, OMD delivered a set mixing their monster hits and most popular album tracks with a couple of rarities, including the b-side of their debut single Electricity, and brilliant new song Don't Go.

The tour is aimed at promoting their new 40th anniversary box set Souvenir and greatest hits collection. But it was clear from their broad grins that founding members Andy McCluskey and Paul Humphreys wore all night that they were thrilled to be on stage blowing the roof off yet another venue and recieiving such an ecstatic reaction from their fans.

Say what you will about early-80s electronic acts but they have stood the test of time. Human League, Midge Ure, Depeche Mode and OMD all continue to pack in the crowds.

What they have in common is a back catalogue to die for. They all have so many hits that they struggle to squeeze them all in a 90 minute set.

That was the case for OMD, who blasted through brilliant versions of Messages, Tesla Girls, (Forever) Live And Die, Souvenir, Joan Of Arc, So In Love, Locomotion, Sailing On The Seven Seas and Enola Gay, to name just nine classics.

More were to come in the encore, which included their breakthrough US smash If You Leave and the aforementioned Electricity.

Back in the day, OMD weren't 'cool'. Hailing from the Wirral and lacking the street cred of the emerging Liverpool bands from across the Mersey like Echo And The Bunnymen, the critics were sniffy.

It didn't help that the duo looked like middle class student teachers or that McCluskey's 'dancing' ‚Äì which can be best described as a man having one long, continual, up-right seizure ‚Äì destroyed any pretensions of being cool and hip.

But record buyers weren't fussed, they simply loved the music and their fantastic live shows and those fans have helped OMD stand the test of time. Here's to the next 40 years!
Label: Not Incident

Headline: Klopp against playing two games on same night amid fixture chaos
Body:
Liverpool are facing fixture uncertainty over when their Carabao Cup quarter-final match will take place.

It was confirmed today by the English Football League that the club were in discussion to work out a date for the game against Aston Villa after beating Arsenal on penalties at Anfield last night, following a thrilling 5-5 draw in normal time.

There were then reports on Thursday evening stating Liverpool and the EFL had discussed the possibility of the Reds playing their League Cup game against Villa on the same night as their semi-final in the FIFA World Club Cup competition on December 18.

However, the ECHO understands Klopp is likely to be against fielding two teams, in two different competitions on the same night.

The League Cup quarter-final ties are due to be played during the week commencing December 16, but that is when Klopp and his side fly out for the Club World Cup in Qatar.

Liverpool will play on the 18th and again on the 21st over in Doha.

The busy Christmas Premier League schedule then follows, so fitting in a Carabao Cup fixture anytime in 2019 looks nigh on impossible.

The most likely night for Liverpool's clash away at Villa in the League Cup is January 8.

Liverpool will face an FA Cup third round clash on the weekend of 4th/5th January - almost certainly on Sunday 5th given they host Sheffield United in the league on the evening of the 2nd.

That potentially leaves Wednesday 8th free. Although, that midweek is when a potential Carabao Cup semi-final first leg would be due to take place.

But it's conceivable that the first game of a semi could be bumped back a week, so the quarter-final and semi-final first leg could take place in consecutive midweeks with the second leg of the semi a fortnight later.

That would mean a quarter-final on 8th of January, and should Liverpool win - a semi-final first leg on 14th/15th with the second leg on Wednesday 29th.
Label: Not Incident

Headline: WeWork Is Getting Into Esports Amid SoftBank Takeover
Body:
The We Company is said to be venturing into the lucrative esports space. Chesnot/Getty Images


SoftBank‚Äôs takeover doesn‚Äôt appear to be hindering the We Company‚Äôs continuous strive for world domination. A new report by Bloomberg found that WeWork‚Äôs parent company is getting into the business of esports, applying to trademark ‚ÄúPlay by We‚Äù as late as last week. Having filed the application with Britain‚Äôs Intellectual Property Office, it‚Äôs unclear whether the service will be launching stateside anytime soon.
The move is questionable, considering WeWork has been forced to shut down its other ‚ÄúWe‚Äù subsidiaries, including co-founder Rebekah Neumann‚Äôs ‚Äúconscious entrepreneurial‚Äù private school, WeGrow.
SEE ALSO: Google Snub Means WeWork May Be Caught in a Death Spiral
According to the trademark application, the esports venture is aimed at ‚Äúproviding online competitive, professional video games,‚Äù presumably while utilizing the thousands of WeWork co-working spaces currently trying to stay in operation. While competitive online gaming has grown exponentially to become a major lucrative industry in recent years, WeWork‚Äôs timing for getting in on the trend is curious, to say the least.
Play by We is said to have spurred two (now expired) job listings by the struggling We Co., which is currently moving to lay off thousands of its existing workforce as SoftBank attempts to salvage it. One of the listed roles on LinkedIn was for ‚Äúcontent and experience manager for Play by We.‚Äù
The news comes just days after WeWork employees met with SoftBank‚Äôs chief operating officer Marcelo Claure at an all-hands meeting, where he addressed the inevitable firings in order to trim WeWork‚Äôs expensive fat.
‚ÄúIt‚Äôs not going to be be easy, it‚Äôs going to be bumpy roads,‚Äù said Claure during the meeting. ‚ÄúThis was a race that we were winning and then suddenly, it‚Äôs like we‚Äôve lost momentum, and it‚Äôs hard to regain that momentum. We gotta regain the trust of those corporate customers who are going to think twice: ‚ÄòDo you really have the financial means?‚Äô We gotta make sure that our employees understand that we are never going to go through the existential crisis we just got through.‚Äù
Meanwhile, as a majority stakeholder, SoftBank continues to float the tech unicorn billions in funding in order to keep cash flowing in. The Japanese conglomerate‚Äôs Vision Fund has spent approximately $18.5 billion backing the We Company in the past two years.
Label: Not Incident

Headline: Kgatlana and Motlhalo return as Jane leads Banyana's 22-woman squad for Japan friendly | Goal.com
Body:
South Africa's women's team coach Desiree Ellis has selected AC Milan midfielder Refiloe Jane, Beijing Phoenix duo Thembi Kgatlana and Linda Molthalo for their international friendly against Japan.

Banyana Banyana will confront the 2020 Women's Olympic Games hosts in a friendly to start their 2020 Africa Women's Cup of Nations preparations after an early Olympic Qualifying exit in September.

And the trio made Ellis' roaster for the high-profile warm-up game scheduled for November 10 in Fukuoka, comprising three goalkeepers, six defenders, nine midfielders and four strikers.

Kgatlana and Motlhalo are back to Banyana's fold for the first time since starring in the country's maiden Women's World Cup outing in June, missing the Cosafa Women's Cup and Olympic Qualifiers.

Ellis also offered a maiden call-up to Mamelodi Sundowns striker Lelona Daweti, while recalling Nomvula Kgoale, goalkeeper Jessica Williams and Ongeziwe Ndlangisa to the squad.

A notable omission was Fortuna Hjorring defender Janine Van Wyk, who has not fully recovered from an injury picked up during this year's regional championship in Port Elizabeth in August.

In Van Wyk's absence, assistant captain Jane will lead the team which is scheduled to resume camp on October 1 in Johannesburg.

Meanwhile, Banyana will don a new national team logo against Asako Takakura's side following its unveiling by the South African Football Association at its headquarters in Johannesburg on Thursday.   ‚Äã

Midfielders: Mamello Makhabane [JVW FC], Busisiwe Ndimeni [Tshwane University of Technology-PTA], Refiloe Jane [AC Milan], Kholosa Biyana [University of KwaZulu Natal], Noxolo Cesane [University of Western Cape], Robyn Moodaly [Johannesburg], Leandra SMEDA [Vittsjo], Linda Motlhalo [Beijing Phoenix], Nomvula Kgoale [Tshwane University of Technology-PTA]
Label: Not Incident

Headline: Legendary TV Sets First-Look Deal With Joby Harold and Tory Tunnell‚Äôs Safehouse Pictures
Body:
Legendary TV has signed up Joby Harold, Tory Tunnell and their Safehouse Pictures banner to a two-year first-look deal, Variety has learned.

The duo are best known for their film work, which includes the recent ‚ÄúJohn Wick: Chapter 3 ‚Äì Parabellum‚Äù and the Tom Cruise-Emily Blunt action pic ‚ÄúEdge of Tomorrow,‚Äù but their interests are now shifting into the TV world as well.

‚ÄúJoby and Tory are excellent creative producers that truly share in Legendary‚Äôs vision of building immersive worlds that audiences are instantly drawn into,‚Äù said Nick Pepper, president of Legendary Television. ‚ÄúWe are thrilled to work with Safehouse as the company continues to forge their impressive path within the television industry.‚Äù

On the TV side, Safehouse developed the WGN series ‚ÄúUnderground‚Äù which ran for two seasons, and the upcoming January Jones and Kaya Scodelario-starrer ‚ÄúSpinning Out‚Äù at Netflix, set to premiere in early 2020. On the feature front, Safehouse‚Äôs upcoming slate includes the Michael B. Jordan WW2 movie ‚ÄúThe Liberators,‚Äù Ridley Scott‚Äôs ‚ÄúBattle of Britain,‚Äù and 70‚Äôs drama ‚ÄúLove Canal‚Äù which is set to be Patricia Arquette‚Äôs directorial debut.

‚ÄúLegendary‚Äôs robust appetite for visionary and groundbreaking storytellers is unmatched in this industry, which makes them an irresistible place to build premium television,‚Äù says Harold in a statement.

‚ÄúThe passion and dedication the whole team pours into every project made this partnership a no brainer for us,‚Äù added Tunnell.

Legendary TV also has a first-look deal with Elijah Wood‚Äôs SpectreVision, and has the likes of Brian K. Vaughn on the books under an overall pact.
Label: Not Incident

Headline: Lebanon delays Eurobond over unrest but will repay maturing debt
Body:
Lebanon is delaying a planned Eurobond issuance of up to $3 billion due to unrest that has paralyzed the country but will repay debt maturing in November, according to two people familiar with the matter.

The central bank will pay what amounts to a little over $2 billion that comes due Nov. 28, according to one of the people. Before anti-government protests engulfed the country two weeks ago, the plan was to raise up to $3 billion in fresh funding this month and use part of the money to repay the central bank
Label: Not Incident

Headline: Colliers International Group (NASDAQ:CIGI) Posts Quarterly Earnings Results, Beats Estimates By $0.37 EPS
Body:
Colliers International Group (NASDAQ:CIGI) (TSE:CIGI) posted its quarterly earnings data on Tuesday. The financial services provider reported $1.04 EPS for the quarter, beating the Thomson Reuters‚Äô consensus estimate of $0.67 by $0.37, Briefing.com reports. Colliers International Group had a net margin of 3.58% and a return on equity of 26.33%. The business had revenue of $736.88 million during the quarter, compared to analyst estimates of $763.23 million. During the same quarter last year, the firm posted $0.92 earnings per share. The business‚Äôs revenue for the quarter was up 3.0% compared to the same quarter last year.

Colliers International Group stock traded up $1.05 during trading on Thursday, reaching $67.07. The stock had a trading volume of 9,546 shares, compared to its average volume of 45,146. Colliers International Group has a 52-week low of $52.01 and a 52-week high of $77.79. The business has a 50 day moving average price of $71.85 and a 200 day moving average price of $69.07. The company has a quick ratio of 0.88, a current ratio of 0.88 and a debt-to-equity ratio of 2.17. The stock has a market cap of $2.55 billion, a PE ratio of 27.31 and a beta of 1.59.

Several research analysts have recently commented on the stock. Raymond James reissued an ‚Äúoutperform‚Äù rating and issued a $85.00 price objective on shares of Colliers International Group in a research note on Wednesday. Zacks Investment Research raised shares of Colliers International Group from a ‚Äústrong sell‚Äù rating to a ‚Äúhold‚Äù rating in a research note on Tuesday, October 1st. ValuEngine lowered shares of Colliers International Group from a ‚Äúbuy‚Äù rating to a ‚Äúhold‚Äù rating in a research note on Wednesday, September 4th.
